    Part II, 2005

    In Ginzburg-Landau theory, superconductivity is due to "supercarriers" of mass msm_{s}ms​ and charge qsq_{s}qs​, which are described by a macroscopic wavefunction ψ\psiψ with "Mexican hat" potential

    V=α(T)∣ψ∣2+12β∣ψ∣4V=\alpha(T)|\psi|^{2}+\frac{1}{2} \beta|\psi|^{4} V=α(T)∣ψ∣2+21​β∣ψ∣4
